title: Content Manager
job_overview:
What This Role Is About

We’re looking for someone to help manage the growing amount of content we use for Reddit. You’ll start off doing a mix of two things:
- Managing content
- Posting on Reddit accounts
As we get more content and accounts coming in, your role will shift fully into content management.

What You’ll Do
In the first few weeks:
Post daily on around 15-20 Reddit accounts
Keep track of which accounts are active, banned, or flagged
Follow our posting protocols
Update our logs and report necessary account/post information


After the transition to full content manager:
Sort and organize content into folders
Label content so it’s easier to reuse (themes, niches, subreddits, etc.)
Use spoofing tools to be able to reuse contents multiple times
Assign the right content to the posting schedule each day
Work closely with the Reddit manager and other Content Manager to keep things running smoothly


What We’re Looking For
You’re good at keeping things organized using basic tools like Google Drive
You can follow a routine but also spot things that need fixing
You’re comfortable working on your own but checking in when needed
You understand Reddit well and can move fast when needed



Nice to Have
Experience posting on Reddit with multiple accounts
You’ve worked with proxy tools or done similar Reddit tasks
